column2: I know) is reserved for Bavette's
column3: the final "on the regular" Chicago review I'll write. I might sprinkle in a few more here or there as catch up
column4: but my two years as a Chicagoland resident have come and gone. Like most ex-Chicagoans
column5: I'll miss the city but not the city's winter. Bavette's opened its doors roughly a year before I moved to Chicago
column6: and I quickly added it to my Yelpy bookmarks. By chance and circumstance
column7: I never went until I was about to leave. I'm glad I squeezed it in.
